hints.content:
This graph shows what happens to point $R$ when you translate the figure by $\langle\red{3},\purple{7}\rangle.$  The point moves by $\red{+3}$ horizontally and $\purple{+7}$ vertically.

$R$ $(1,-3)$ is transformed into $R'$ $(4,4)$.

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0450d707e93ac22809e8e4063f74b98bf35d079e.png)

We can transform the other vertices by adding $\red{3}$ to the $x$-coordinate and adding $\purple{7}$ to the $y$-coordinate.
 
$G$ $(-3,-3)$ is transformed into $G'$ $(0,4)$.  
$A$ $(1,0)$ is transformed into $A'$ $(4,7)$.

The translated image looks like this:

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/dcbfde322f50640db9f40bf4b79824ad9014d8db.png)
